comments.commentBody: C.  Sorry, I'm mad.

Democrats will be happy to work with Republicans, if Republicans show an interest in anything beyond their party affiliation. I haven't seen that in the last, oh, 40 years.  Call me when a Republican has a legislative idea that didn't come from ALEC.

@ Socrates

Nasdrovia!!!
Excellent question. Maybe one Jefferson B. Sessions didn't want to answer so he took the approved Trump administration method and lied in the hopes of never hearing about it again?
Going to the Rock 'n' Roll Hall of Fame?

From the way Sen. Franken posed the question ,Sessions could rightly assume he was being asked if the Trump campaign had been meeting with Joe Stalin.
He gave a truthful answer to that question.
I'm sorry, but on what planet was Sessions' answer truthful?

This is absolute nonsense. You do know Stalin is dead, yes? So did you have a serious point at all? Nope, none at all.

Leave the deflection and lying to the Trump administration. After all, they're the experts at it. And if they keep it up long enough, there will be a body of lawbreaking on which even the Republican congress will have to take action.

Remember, most people who went to jail for Watergate were convicted of the cover up. Which seems to be cooking just fine in this scandal. Many of us pointed out that there would be real consequences for the total incompetence of Trump & Co. It would be quite a relief if those consequences were the end of Trump's presidency, rather than a shooting war with Iran or China, or a nuclear exchange with North Korea.
Are you suggesting he might have known something we didn't?
Hoe do you sail a rowboat?

I'm reminded of the former Cleveland Indian's outfielder, Richie Scheinblum, from a while back who said, "Playing in Cleveland isn't all bad.  At least you don't have to go there on road trips."  Now Cleveland is getting another sliming to go with the Cuyahoga River catching on fire and the Scheinblum comment.  If Clevelanders knew what would have happened by getting the GOP convention last year, I'm sure they wouldn't have applied for it.  Be careful what you ask for.  Progress was in place after last years Cavaliers championship NBA team and the Indians near world series victory.  But alas, they keep pulling us back.  But on a more hopeful topic, there's always the Browns.
Nancy Pelosi is not the Attorney General, and she did not lie under oath.

I so wish all this was frivolous, LW. I'm afraid that is not so.

As for the airports, try this HuffPost link for the airports involved. http://tinyurl.com/hfr3to4

Oh, and Trump has been tweeting this morning about his phones being wiretapped by Obama.

I have no idea where this is all going, but my guess is all this will make WaterGate look like trivial stuff.

All Don Trump's little kiddies are jokes; it's just that they have different punch lines.
Pence "but I didn't break any law of Indiana"
Tillerson just grins and "bears" it.
Flynn "in like Flynn" and then gone, like Flynn.
Sessions extra session in committee (not)
Mnuchin "robosign"
Ross Director of Bank of Cyprus (check THAT out)
Price (what IS your price, anyway)
Perry abolish that department, what is it anyway? and what does it do?
Pruitt so dumb he has to have oil companies write his letters; can you say plagiarize?
McMahon wrestling queen
Clearly Don Trump want to be the brightest star in his heaven. Too bad it's a shooting star.
except -- Jeff Sessions LIED under oath!   that we cannot shut up about!
Jeff Sessions should be canned! It is outrageous that the top cop is a dangerous liar.
Insist!
So now the Appalachian Trail goes through Cleveland.  Gol-lee
Excellent!

Yes, my Senator Collins (who is so nice) voted for the ugly hearted Jeff Sessions because he's 'so nice'. So Nice. But also a liar. Also a racist. But he's such a sweet liar and racist.

I'm so sick of all these people. All they do is lie and obfuscate. They do not help the American People. At all.

I hope Sessions has to quit. Lie to the Senate under oath? Come on, man! If any of us 'normals' would do such a thing we'd be thrown in prison. But these guys? They slime away, to slime another day.

Get rid of them ALL. (Well....except for Amy Klobuchar and Al Franken, both from Minnesota. What do they have in the water up there that makes good senators?).

His tax returns would resolve so many suspicions, one wonders why Trump refuses to share them with the American people to end the intrigue. No guess work about relationships with the Kremlin and no worries about Putin blackmailing our President. Instead, we are increasingly concerned as Trump's associates admit Russian contacts, when the President has categorically denied any contacts. When caught, Trump and company misdirect us to Schumer and Pelosi, to Obama, to progressive shame at losing, to anything that takes our focus from his lies. Trump's team list of contacts and denials:(http://www.usatoday.com/story/news/politics/2017/03/02/trump-teams-many-...
Any and all contacts are under suspicion as a result because Trump has become utterly untrustworthy. Trump's spokespersons are all caught up in lies. Can Trump ever restore trust?

Trump and his loyal Republicans in Congress should remember that it wasn't the Watergate burglary itself, but the cover-up, that led to Nixon's downfall.  The Republicans of that era had the good sense to participate in the investigation of Nixon and his cronies.

The Democratic Party is in free fall. This is all they have. Put up evidence, the facts that sessions or anyone conspired with the Russians to steal the election. Does the CIA or FBI have anything? People would have been arrested by now.

O that's right it's only non sense and politicians doing what they do best which nothing constructive. No one conspired, Hillary lost the election because they turned their backs on the parties long term core, which is labor. And cheating in the CNN debate didn't help her chances, demonstrated a lack of character.

The DNC cared so much however forgot its core which is labor Where did they labor part of the democrats go? With President Trump.
You're delfecting. The problem with Sessions isn't the meeting with Russians (on the face of it) it's the lying.
Well, we now know that the GOP will protect a habitual liar and sacrifice the integrity of the United States over money, power and racism.

I have not seen anything from this President or any of his minions that changes my view of him as " a clear and present danger" to my country.
Yes, his speech on Tues. was well delivered and he actually sounded like an adult (for that hour) and not a 5th grade petulant child.
But what I find extremely distressing are the (non)actions of the Republicans in Congress, especially regarding the interference in our electoral process by a foreign actor, Russia! Why are they not vigorously pursuing this investigation? Are they THAT fearful of where that trail might lead, thereby threatening their right wing agenda? And, the people of this country, we citizens, are left with little recourse but protests....loud, constant, pointed protests! We will defend our nation, if our leaders won't.
I think perhaps a mild dose of ritalin held him in check.  There was a distinct change in his affect, noticeable for much of the time.

You do realize that this entire election hung on the 80,000 votes spread across four states that decided the contest, don't you? Had there been no "trumped up" Clinton email scandal (you listening, VP Pence?) and no James Comey last minute "Ooh, wait, I think there's more evidence...No, nothing there. Sorry." statements about Uma Abbedin's laptop and her emails, there might have been a female President, decent health care (care, not insurance) for all, cheap or free college educations for everyone who wanted one, no strip-mining in national parks and wilderness areas, no suspicious ties to Russian plutocrats, and finally, a respectful, decent, caring person at the helm of this country.
Instead of a twisted, sociopathic eight year old calling everyone names and destroying this country a little more every day.
Liberals aren't better than anyone else; we want the same things you want: safety for our children, decent jobs, safe food and water, no wars. But we are willing to say the Emperor has no clothes, though in this case it's the Emperor has no scruples.
He's a bad man, RichD. A thug in a nice suit. But still a thug. And both of us, you and I, and the rest of America deserve better.

Winning is not really everything. That is the difference between a nation of laws and a nation of personality cults. Mad King Donald may seem well on his way to becoming the American Hugo Chavez, or the American Putin but we will not let that happen.

Thank you Roger Cohen for reminding us that behind the manichéen bluster, disinformation and "Bannonification" of our executive branch of government there lies a substrate of virtue. I remain weary of our ability to rekindle those values when half of our politic is accomplice to this disruption, or is it destruction.

His contempt and complete disregard for the oath he fraudulently took at his inauguration, and his abject treason against the US constitution should have immediately been challenged and he should have been put on trial for sedition and as a traitor.

His emotions are infantile, and when he doesn't get exactly what he wants, the minute when he wants it, he may be capable of petulantly destroying everyone and everything around him, like a spoiled child, smugly reveling in the attention he receives and chaos he caused.
